newsitem.title: UK: UK's Major promises manifesto for long term.
newsitem.headline: UK's Major promises manifesto for long term.

text.p: Prime Minister John Major on Tuesday pledged the Conservatives' manifesto for the May 1 election would be a far-reaching one "that sets out substantive long-term policies of what we will do to tackle the issues of the future".

Major told a news conference that while his party's policies, in the manifesto to be launched on Wednesday, would be "clear cut, detailed and costed", those of his opponents would be full of contradictions.
"I intend to deal with how to build on the best economy for a generation, how to spread opportunity and prosperity to every home in the country," Major said.
